meanings.sent1: I will preannounce the party to make sure everyone can come.
meanings.sent2: The company will preannounce their new product launch next week.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to preannounce his disappearing act to build anticipation.
meanings.sent4: The teacher preannounced the surprise quiz, causing panic among the students.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecast preannounced heavy rain for the weekend.

meanings.sent1: The preannounce of the event helped attendees plan their schedules.
meanings.sent2: We received a preannounce about the upcoming changes in the office.
meanings.sent3: The preannounce of the sale made shoppers excited for the discounts.
meanings.sent4: The preannounce of the movie premiere created buzz among the audience.
meanings.sent5: The preannounce of the guest speaker drew a large crowd to the event.
